items.title: Hurricane Melissa-hit Caribbean to get $7M in Canadian humanitarian aid
items.description: Global Affairs Canada wrote Thursday afternoon that it was 'not aware of any Canadian citizens who have been injured or killed as a result of this hurricane.'

items.title: Wildlife photographer helps save elk trapped in netting in Prince Albert National Park
items.description: Avid wildlife photographer Rod Young reported a bull elk in distress to Prince Albert National Park staff, who then tranquilized the animal and freed it from the man-made netting.

items.title: Winnipeg mom says despite progress, more mental health supports needed
items.description: A Winnipeg mother is reflecting on progress being made in mental health services in Manitoba a decade after the death of her son.

items.title: Carney tours newly completed South Korean sub as Canada weighs multibillion-dollar order
items.description: South Korea's prime minister put his political weight behind his country's multibillion-dollar bid to sell Canada submarines. Kim Min-seok accompanied his Canadian counterpart, Mark Carney, on a tour of the Hanwha Ocean Ltd. yard ahead of the APEC summit.

items.title: NHL star subs in as coach of N.S. minor hockey team to support a grieving family
items.description: Florida Panthers forward Brad Marchand, who is from Hammonds Plains, N.S., said he didn't hesitate to come home once he learned his friend's 10-year-old daughter died after a battle with cancer.

items.title: Health care admin system with $272M price tag should be scrapped, says union
items.description: A health care workers' union says they want to see the problematic AIMS scrapped as the province announces it is taking one phase out of commission.

items.title: Doctors in Montreal can now prescribe their patients tickets to the orchestra
items.description: Doctors in Montreal are prescribing music as medicine.

items.title: Truck driver industry crackdown coming in budget to target ‘Drivers Inc.'
items.description: 'The ultimate goal is to make sure that we send an even stronger message to the cheaters out there that we're going to find you,' Hajdu said.

items.title: As Carney set to meet with China's Xi, here's what to watch for
items.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday at a summit in South Korea will discuss "a much broader set of issues than trade."

items.title: Kelowna could have more short-term rental options by fall of 2026
items.description: The provincial government brought in the restrictions in early 2024 to address the severe shortage of long-term housing.

items.title: Immigration minister says bill's trigger for new powers intentionally vague
items.description: Lena Diab says the definition of a 'public interest' event that would allow her department to pause or revoke immigration applications was left open-ended in Bill C-12.

items.title: BC Confesses Concerns about a Pipeline Property Tax Cut
items.description: After a Tyee report, the legislature grapples with a change that could cost homeowners.

items.title: Photos: Electronic powerhouses Kaytranada and Justice co-headline Rogers Arena
items.description: The DJ and the French duo combined for a memorable show.

items.title: Gwar's Vancouver show in photos: few things entertain more than a blood-drenched spectacle
items.description: Get the best of Vancouver in your inbox, every Tuesday and Thursday. Sign up for our free newsletter.

items.title: Are you being tricked by your treats? Some Halloween candy multipacks have shrunk in size, but not in price
items.description: CBC News discovered two major candy makers, Mars Inc. and the Hershey Company, had reduced the weight of several of their Halloween chocolate bar variety packs compared to last year by as much as almost 17 per cent.

items.title: Liquified, composted: How green are these alternative death practices?
items.description: In this issue of our environmental newsletter, we look at the environmental impacts of two alternatives to burial and cremation of human bodies; check out a new kind of floating solar panel; and look into an idea to boost recycling rates and help vulnerable people at the same time.

items.title: Hunter mauled by grizzly bear west of Calgary
items.description: Alberta Fish and Wildlife says a man was mauled by a grizzly bear south of Cochrane, Alta. The bear was subsequently shot by the man's hunting partner.

items.title: This Alberta mountain town plays a big role in the fitness watch craze
Farkas addresses Calgary's business community, promises ‘sharpened pencils' ahead of budget
items.description: Calgary mayor Jeromy Farkas indicated there is consensus amongst the new city council that next year's proposed tax increase is 'far too high.'

items.title: Five things you may not know about the 1995 Quebec referendum
items.description: Here are five things you may not know — or may have forgotten — about the 1995 referendum.
